III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to

Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.

Type
Allegation Youth A was sexually abused by staff.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Chief Program Officer (CFO) for the facility
received a court summons outlining allegations of sexual
abuse of Youth A by Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4
between 2009-2011. CFO provided the court summons to
Primary Consultant on 1/2/24. CFO did not work at the facility at
the time the allegations occurred and does not have additional
information regarding the allegations.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at Bellamy Creek
Correctional Facility on 1/22/24 alone by MDHHS Worker and
face to face on 2/20/24 by this Consultant in conjunction with
MDHHS Worker. It should be noted Youth A was unable to
provide last names for the alleged staff, but was able to provide
their first names, a physical description of each, and the details of
the allegations.
2

Youth A reported on or around Easter or Spring of 2009 (March,
April, or May), he was placed at Kid’s First, which was located on
St. John’s Home Residential’s campus. Youth A reported Staff 2
worked as a youth counselor/specialist at St. John’s Home
Residential and, near the end of May 2009, he would have sexual
relations with her. He reported he would have vaginal intercourse
with Staff 2 in the bathroom of the facility, in his bedroom at the
facility, in the basement of Kid’s First or at Staff 2’s residence.
Youth A reported he did not wear a condom and ejaculated inside
her. Youth A reported they had sexual intercourse on five or six
occasions at Kid’s First. Youth A reported Youth C, Youth D and
Youth G witnessed Youth A having sex with Staff 2 and Youth A
also witnessed the other youth having sexual intercourse with
Staff 2. Youth A reported Staff 2 would drive the youth to her
residence in her car or the Kid’s First vehicle. Youth A reported
Staff 2 would say they were going to the YMCA, but she would
only drop a couple youth off at the YMCA, and she would take the
others, including Youth A, to her residence. Youth A reported her
residence was in a neighborhood near Kid’s First. Youth A denied
anyone else being at the residence. Youth A reported
approximately five or six times, he and Staff 2 had sexual
intercourse and oral sex at Staff 2’s residence. Youth A reported
after leaving her residence, they would return to the YMCA or go
to the mall before returning to Kid’s First. Youth A denied being
forced to have sexual relations with Staff 2. Youth A reported Staff
2 would allow him to stay up late, play video games, and “a lot of
good stuff”. Youth A reported he left Kid’s First in 2009 and was
placed in a different facility. Youth A reported in 2011, he was
placed at Hunting House at St. John’s Home Residential. Youth A
reported in 2011, he told Staff 1 and Director about his encounters
with Staff 2 in 2009. Youth A reported Director stated she would
investigate the situation, but he heard from staff (couldn’t
remember who), she just wanted to “sweep it under the rug” and
not do anything about it. Youth A reported Staff 1 told him it was
handled and didn’t want to talk about the situation.
Youth A reported on or around the summer of 2011, he went to
Staff 1’s residence with a group of other youth from the facility so
they could go swimming. Youth A reported Staff 1 would take him,
Youth B and/or Youth D to the mall or skating rink “Fun Spot”.
Youth A reported sometimes Staff 1 would drop the other youth off
at the skating rink and then would take Youth A to her residence
instead of taking him to work at Craig’s Cruisers. Youth A reported
a couple times, he went to Staff 1’s residence with just her and
Youth B. Youth A reported when he and Staff 1 went to Staff 1’s
home, they started out with small talk and then Staff 1 asked
3

Youth A if he would have sex with her. Youth A reported he was
“at first not with it, but she was persistent”. Youth A reported they
would perform oral sex on each other, and he would have vaginal
intercourse with her. Youth A reported he thinks it happened
approximately five or six times at Staff 1’s residence. Youth A
recalled another time he was with Staff 1 at her residence, Staff 1
began kissing him and then she performed oral sex on him. Youth
A reported they then went to a “plain bedroom” with cream colored
and dark brown walls and laid down on the bed. Youth A reported
while on the bed, he performed oral sex on her and then he had
sex with her. Youth A reported he did not wear a condom and he
ejaculated inside her. Youth A reported afterwards, they went
back to the skating rink to pick up some other youth and went
back to the facility. Youth A reported Staff 1 would have sex with
him at the facility as well. Youth A reported they would have sex in
his bedroom and in the basement of Hunting House whenever
they could get time alone. Youth A reported Staff 1 would
communicate with him via a cell phone he was able to obtain.
Youth A reported because he would have sex with her, Staff 1
would buy him shoes at the mall or food. Youth A reported Youth
B told him he did things with Staff 1 too, but Youth A did not
witness anything. Youth A denied being forced to have sexual
relations with Staff 1. Youth A denied telling any staff at the facility
about this information and stated no staff at the facility knew what
was happening. This information was disclosed during the civil
case which is what initiated the current investigation. Youth A
reported when he was older and attending college classes, he
saw Staff 1 in downtown Grand Rapids, they talked for a few
minutes, and then he went to class.
Youth A reported in 2011 while he was placed in Hunting House at
the facility, the house supervisor was Staff 3. Youth A reported on
or around October 2011, Staff 3 was upset with Youth A for
skipping school because Staff 3 assumed Youth A was doing
drugs and felt Youth A was “the leader of the pack”. Youth A
reported Staff 3 picked him and Youth B up from school and took
them to Staff 3’s residence. Youth A reported Staff 3 conducted a
strip search of Youth A and Youth B at the residence because
Staff 3 thought they were bringing drugs into the facility. Youth A
reported he was completely naked, and Staff conducted an anal
cavity search with his fingers on Youth A and Youth B. Youth A
reported neither youth wanted to allow the search, but Staff 3 told
Youth A if he didn’t cooperate, he would be sent to a new
placement or would no longer be allowed to attend off-campus
school. Youth A reported after the search was completed, they left
Staff 3’s home and returned to the facility. Youth A denied telling
4

anyone about the incident or informing staff at the facility about
the strip search. Youth A reported Staff 3 lived in a white house
with a small yard, located near Sweet St. and Dale St. in Grand
Rapids. Youth A noted it was near Creston High School, which is
where he attended school. Youth A denied ever seeing Staff 3 in
the yard or street outside of Staff 3’s home or saying hi to him.
Youth A reported he never lived on Dale St. but had friends who
stayed on Sweet St., which runs parallel to it and would go to their
homes sometimes. Youth A reported one time he went AWOL and
went to another home in that area, which was the residence of
another youth he met in placement. Youth A reported another time
he went AWOL, went to another friend’s home who lived in that
neighborhood, and then went to the laundromat in the
neighborhood to call and get a ride back to the facility. Youth A
then changed his story and reported he was never in the
neighborhoods by Creston High School between 2009-2011
because he was in placement, didn’t have any friends in those
neighborhoods between 2009-2011, and didn’t know any St.
John’s Home Residential staff members who lived in the
neighborhood by the school.
Youth A reported in early November 2011, he and Youth B were
waiting to be picked up from basketball practice at Creston High
School. He reported they waited for an hour before they walked
down the street to North End Convenience Store to purchase
snacks. Youth A reported they then walked to his girlfriend’s
house and asked her mother to give them a ride back to the
facility. Youth A reported when they arrived at the facility, Staff 4
said he was not allowing them in without a strip search because
staff members were informed several individuals witnessed Youth
A and Youth B stealing snacks from Meijer instead of attending
basketball practice. Youth A reported he told Staff 4 no and said
he would not be allowing a strip search. Youth A reported Staff 4
told them if they didn’t comply, he would call the police and report
they were stealing from Meijer. Youth A reported he went inside
Hunting House reluctantly, entered the first room on the left, and
Staff 4 conducted a strip search. Youth A reported he was
completely naked, and Staff 4 looked at him during the search, but
denied Staff 4 touched him during the strip search. Youth A
denied telling anyone about the incident or informing staff at the
facility about the strip search. Youth A reported Staff 4 would play
basketball with him at the facility and would smack Youth A’s butt
or rub up against Youth A too closely while playing. Youth A
denied reporting these concerns to anyone.
5

Youth C was interviewed face to face at Ionia Correctional
Facility on 2/20/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth
C reported he remembers a youth with Youth A’s first name but
couldn’t remember his last name. Youth C reported he was never
present for any sexual encounters between Youth A and Staff 2.
Youth C reported he never saw Staff 2 interact with Youth A
inappropriately and never heard of Youth A and Staff 2 having
sexual encounters with each other.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face on 1/31/24 alone by
MDHHS Worker and via phone on 3/1/24 by this Consultant.
Staff 1 reported she worked at the facility from February/March
2011 until June 2013. She reported she began as a direct care
staff member at Hunting House and was promoted to a supervisor
in September/October 2011. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 was her
predecessor and trained her to be a supervisor prior to him
leaving the facility. Staff 1 reported she did not have any concerns
about Staff 3’s interactions with any youth and no youth ever
disclosed any concerns to her regarding Staff 3. Staff 1 reported
when staff members were concerned about a youth having
contraband, they would look through a youth’s backpack or bag
and then they would have the youth empty their pockets and
remove their shoes. Staff 1 reported if they felt the youth was
hiding something in their clothes, two staff members would take
the youth to the bathroom and have them change their clothes
(except their underwear) so staff could search the clothing. Staff 1
reported youth were never strip searched or forced to remove all
their clothing during a contraband search.
Staff 1 reported she remembered Youth A. Staff 1 reported within
a year after she stopped working at the facility, she ran into Youth
A in downtown Grand Rapids in front of the parking garage. Staff
1 reported she was walking to or from court and he told her he
was on his way to class. Staff 1 reported he said, “Hey Ms. [Staff
1]”, they exchanged some casual conversation about how they
were doing, and then they parted ways.
Staff 1 reported she did not know Staff 2 because Staff 2 left the
facility approximately 2 years before Staff 1 began working there.
Staff 1 denied Youth A ever talked to her about Staff 2, disclosed
any concerns to her about Staff 2 or disclosed being sexually
abused by Staff 2.
Staff 1 reported she did not remember taking Youth A, Youth B,
and/or Youth D to Fun Spot, but she might have taken them to the
mall. Staff 1 did not recall a situation where she dropped some
6

youth off at a mall and took other youth to another location. Staff 1
reported staff would utilize the facility’s clothing allowance funds to
purchase youth clothes and shoes, but she never used her
personal money to purchase things for youth. Staff 1 reported the
only time she ever bought any clothing or shoes for Youth A was
utilizing the facility’s money when they went on a group trip with
other youth and staff to go school shopping. Staff 1 reported these
shopping trips happened twice per year. Staff 1 reported she
never purchased a cell phone for Youth A, never communicated
with him via cell phone, and was not aware he had a cell phone
while at the facility.
Staff 1 reported she lived with her parents when she initially began
working at the facility. Staff 1 reported they had an inground pool
surrounded by a concrete patio as well as a basketball court, so
she would have staff come over to hang out sometimes. Staff 1
also noted they would have youth from the facility come to the
home during the summer to swim in the pool. Staff 1 reported this
was approved by Program Manager as another summer activity
they could do besides going to the YMCA. Staff 1 reported they
went to her parents’ home to swim more than once but less than
five times. Staff 1 reported there were approximately 3-4 youth
and at least one other staff member that went each time. Staff 1
reported her parents were also home each time they went. Staff 1
reported Youth A was one youth in the group of youth that went to
her parent’s house to go swimming. Staff 1 reported the youth
were not allowed inside the home, and they were only allowed to
use the bathroom immediately inside the entrance door. Staff 1
reported only one person was allowed in the bathroom at a time
for safety reasons.
Staff 1 reported she never took Youth A to her parents’ home
alone, and she was never there alone with any other youth either.
Staff 1 reported there was never a time when she dropped other
youth off at a skating rink and let Youth A skip work and come
home with her instead. Staff 1 denied ever being alone with Youth
A at the facility. Staff 1 reported because it was a male youth
home, she and other female staff were very conscious not to be
alone with youth. Staff 1 denied she ever had sex or performed
sexual acts with any youth, including Youth A, at her parents’
house, another residence, or anywhere at the facility. Staff 1
reported she has no idea why Youth A would allege these things
because they never happened.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 1/31/24 by Primary
Consultant in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
7

reported she worked at the facility from 2008-2009 and was
employed at Kid’s First, which was located on St. John’s campus,
but was a different facility. Staff 2 reported she was cross trained
at St. John’s Home Residential facility as well but did not work in
the homes on their campus. Staff 2 reported she worked an entry
level position where she was a counselor working directly with the
youth, but clarified she was not a therapist. Staff 2 admitted to
having CSC charges she pled down to third or fourth degree. Staff
2 reported these charges were a result of her having sex with two
youth (Youth C and Youth E) at Kid’s First. Staff 2 reported she
doesn’t remember a youth with Youth A’s name. Staff 2 denied
ever having sex or performing any sexual acts with Youth A. Staff
2 reported she never had any sexual relations with youth at St.
John’s Home Residential. Staff 2 reported she has no idea why
these allegations are being made because she doesn’t even know
who Youth A is.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 1/31/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he worked at the facility
from 2009 until August/September 2011. He reported he was
initially a direct care worker, but then became the house
supervisor at Hunting House. Staff 3 reported he never heard any
allegations from youth or staff about any youth or staff having
inappropriate relationships. Staff 3 reported if he would have
heard about any inappropriate things going on, he absolutely
would have reported it. Staff 3 reported he was not sure if there
was a policy or training stating staff members could not take youth
to their homes, but there was a rule they could not be friends with
youth on social media.
Before being asked about the specific allegations, Staff 3 was
asked to describe the color and location of the home he lived in
while working at the facility. Staff 3 reported his home was down
the street from Creston High School, which is where a lot of the
youth from the facility attended school. Staff 3 was asked if he
ever saw Youth A or Youth B outside of the facility. Staff 3
reported at one point after he stopped working at the facility,
Youth B must have lived around his neighborhood because he
would see Youth B riding around on his bike sometimes. Staff 3
reported in 2012 (after he stopped working at the facility), Youth A
moved to or visited a home two doors down from him. Staff 3
reported one time he was outside his home, saw Youth A, they
said “hi” to each other, and then Youth A continued walking. Staff
3 reported he only saw Youth A in the neighborhood a couple
times after that. Staff 3 was then asked more specific questions
related to the allegations. Staff 3 reported there were times he had
8

to pick youth up (including Youth A and Youth B) from the school
and bring them back to the facility. Staff 3 reported he doesn’t
remember there ever being concerns of Youth A or Youth B
bringing drugs to the facility. Staff 3 doesn’t remember there being
a situation where he picked Youth A and Youth B up from school
for that reason, and Staff 3 reported he never brought them back
to his home after picking them up from school.
Staff 3 was asked what staff would do if they had suspicions of
youth having contraband. Staff 3 reported typically whichever staff
member on shift had the best relationship with the youth would be
the one to approach a youth and ask about contraband. Staff 3
reported if a youth came back from AWOL, an outing, school, etc.
and there was suspicion they had drugs or other contraband, staff
members would search their bag or backpack. Staff 3 reported if
there was a concern the youth was high, the facility would drug
test the youth. Staff 3 reported if there were concerns about
contraband, staff members would have to search the youth’s
room, search their belongings, inventory items, have the youth
empty their pockets and ask the youth if they had any contraband.
Staff 3 reported if nothing was found during these searches, they
would be done. Staff 3 reported he has never been a part of any
searches asking a youth to remove their clothes or pat a youth
down, and they were never trained to do either of those kinds of
searches. Staff 3 reported he doesn’t know of any strip searches
or cavity searches ever being performed by any staff. Staff 3
vehemently denied ever completing a strip search or cavity search
on any youth, including Youth A and Youth B. Staff 3 reported
having any youth complete a strip search or any staff completing a
cavity search on a youth would be completely inappropriate. Staff
3 was shocked and appalled by the allegations and did not know
why these allegations were made, because they never happened.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 2/26/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 doesn’t remember any concerns
regarding Staff 1 and never heard or saw her do anything
inappropriate. Staff 4 doesn’t remember them being allowed to
take youth to Staff 1’s parent’s pool. Staff 4 reported they had a
YMCA membership for swimming, so he doesn’t know why they
would have swum anywhere else. Staff 4 reported Staff 3 was
very “by the book” and strictly followed policies/procedures. Staff 4
reported when a youth returned from AWOL, staff members had to
search the youth’s belongings and have the youth empty their
pockets because it was policy, but that’s all they had to do. Staff 4
reported he never heard of or saw any staff members conducting
strip searches for any youth. Staff 4 reported he never conducted
9

or participated in a strip search for Youth A, Youth B, or any other
youth. Staff 4 reported the facility was very strict about how and
when searches were done and ensuring policies were followed.
Staff 4 reported the facility never allowed staff members to be
alone with youth except during mentoring sessions. Staff 4
reported any contraband searches were completed with 2 or more
staff members present. Staff 4 reported he remembered Youth A
being good at basketball and remembered playing basketball with
him and others. Staff 4 reported he never did anything
inappropriate with any of the youth, including Youth A, while
playing basketball with them. Staff 4 reported he never smacked
Youth A’s butt or any other youths’ butts while playing basketball
because it is very inappropriate.
Program Manager (PM) was interviewed face to face on
2/12/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. PM reported she
started working at the facility in the summer of 2010 and left in the
fall of 2018. PM reported the general rule of thumb for contraband
searches was to conduct the least invasive search possible for the
scenario. She reported there were certain protocols in place for
certain youth if there was an elevated risk factor (i.e. self-harm,
suicide-risk, etc.). She reported they didn’t regularly search youth,
and only conducted searches if there was reasonable suspicion,
or returning from AWOL, employment, outings, or home visits. PM
reported the house manager, and the therapist would agree what
protocol was necessary for the scenario and the youth. PM
reported strip searches or cavity searches were never allowed,
authorized, or trained. PM reported if there was suspicion a youth
had contraband in their clothes, at least two staff would take a set
of clean clothes and ask the youth to change in the bathroom so
they could check the clothes the youth was wearing. PM reported
the youth would be in the bathroom by themselves with the door
closed. PM reported she never received any information, concerns
or complaints from any youth or staff regarding strip searches or
cavity searches occurring.
PM reported each youth was assigned a mentor/advocate staff
member who could take the youth on outings, but there was never
authorization provided for staff to take a youth to their home. PM
reported they ran a relationship-based program, so mentor
relationships were supposed to be close between youth and staff,
but only in a therapeutic way. PM reported before any outing could
occur, the staff member would have to fill out a detailed form with
specific information (i.e. location, timeframe, participants, crisis
plan, etc.), and have it approved by the house manager.
10

PM reported she never had any concerns about Staff 1 and no
youth ever brought any concerns to her regarding Staff 1. PM
reported Staff 1 was a great worker and house manager and all
the youth loved her. PM reported she doesn’t remember
approving Staff 1 to take youth to her parent’s house to swim, but
she couldn’t say for certain. PM reported typically the approval
would come from another house manager and might not rise to
her level of approval. PM reported they took the youth to swim at
the YMCA often too, and there were always rules in place
regarding staff supervision, only one youth going to the bathroom
at a time to change, etc.
PM reported she does not know Staff 2 because Staff 2 was
terminated from employment before PM began working at the
facility. PM reported she never had any concerns about Staff 3
and the only concerns youth ever stated were Staff 3 was too
strict, very structured and a consistent rule follower. PM does not
remember Staff 4’s name or any information about him. PM
reported Youth A never brought any concerns or complaints to her
regarding his alleged sexual relationship with Staff 1 and Staff 2,
or inappropriate touches/searches by Staff 3 and Staff 4. PM
reported if Youth A would have shared any of these concerns with
her or Director, they would have immediately begun an internal
investigation and referred the complaints to the proper authorities.
Director was interviewed face to face on 2/13/24 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Director reported she started
working at the facility in 2006, became the Director of Kid’s First,
then became the Director of the entire facility campus in 2010, and
then left the facility in 2016. Director reported staff were not
allowed to take kids to their personal homes and any outings off-
campus needed approval. Director doesn’t remember a situation
where any staff members were allowed to take youth to their
parent’s pool to go swimming. Director reported they had access
to community pools, so she doesn’t know why that would have
happened or been allowed. Director reported she put a high
importance on liability and, had she known, she would have
contacted their licensing consultant at the time for consultation
prior to approving something like that. Director doesn’t remember
Staff 1 or Staff 4 but does remember Staff 2 and Staff 3. Director
reported Staff 3 was a really good staff member and she doesn’t
remember hearing any concerns or complaints about him. Director
reported she remembers Staff 2 because of the lawsuit, criminal
investigation, and licensing investigation after Staff 2’s
inappropriate sexual encounters with youth at the facility. Director
reported they had an open-door policy for concerns and
11

complaints from youth, there was a box to leave anonymous
notes/complaints, there would be scheduled townhall meetings to
check in with youth about staff/services/etc., and quarterly
anonymous surveys were given to youth as well. Director reported
she doesn’t remember Youth A or Youth B. Director reported she
doesn’t remember a youth with Youth A’s name disclosing
information to her about Staff 2. Director reported if a youth would
have disclosed anything regarding inappropriate conduct by a staff
member, she would have dealt with it right away and contacted
licensing. Director reported for contraband searches, there was
always more than one staff doing the search. Director reported
she doesn’t remember there being a lot of concerns or issues
surrounding contraband being brought to the facility. Director
reported strip searches or cavity searches were never trained and
wouldn’t have been tolerated. Director reported she never heard
of any staff conducting either type of search on a youth, and never
received complaints from youth about these types of searches.
